member.name: IOleInPlaceObjectWindowless.GetDropTarget
member.summary: Retrieves the interface for an in-place active, windowless object that supports drag and drop.
member.param: A pointer to an pointer variable that receives the interface pointer to the windowless object.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

listheader.description: The windowless object does not support drag and drop.

member.name: IOleInPlaceObjectWindowless.OnWindowMessage
member.summary: Dispatches a message from a container to a windowless object that is in-place active.
member.param: The identifier for the window message provided to the container by Windows.
A parameter for the window message provided to the container by Windows.
A parameter for the window message provided to the container by Windows.
A pointer to result code for the window message.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

listheader.description: The windowless object did not process the window message. The container should call the DefWindowProc for the message or process the message itself as described below.

summary.para: Enables a windowless object to process window messages and participate in drag and drop operations. It is derived from and extends the interface.

A small object, such as a control, does not need a window of its own. Instead, it can rely on its container to dispatch window messages and help the object to participate in drag and drop operations. The container must implement the interface. Otherwise, the object must act as a normal compound document object and create a window when it is activated.
